history.content:
The class does not have any prereqs.

Assuming the summer enrollment system is the same as the regular semester's: CalCentral will not allow you to add the course, but neither will it kick you off the waitlist. You'll just be stuck on the waitlist unless you drop your other courses.

You can either check CalCentral's course scheduler to see what the enrollment restrictions are yourself, or ask the department what the enrollment policies are / how these restrictions may change. The course catalog seems to imply that only declared majors can enroll right now though.

You can also try enrolling in the course via its other name: Ling C105, which may not have the same enrollment restrictions.

Hi there, This EECS page is not administered or reviewed by the cognitive science department. These questions about their policies should be directed to their office.

- Not a CogSci Major. I have 0 Cog Sci background. Will taking this class be a problem?

- I'm currently on the waitlist for Summer Cog Sci 101. However, it conflicts with my current summer classes. I plan to drop them if I get into this class. If the waitlist reaches me, will Cal central not allow me to add and kick me off the waitlist?

- Also, there seem to be 17 Available Seats but there's a waitlist of 7 and im #7.Is there some sort priority restrictions/reservations that are not allowing people to sign up for the available seats?
history.subject: Summer CogSci101 questions
